title: Mercer, Tennessee
text:
Mercer is an <a href="unincorporated%20community">unincorporated community</a> in <a href="Madison%20County%2C%20Tennessee">Madison County</a>, Tennessee, United States. It is located along <a href="Tennessee%20State%20Route%20138">State Route 138</a> halfway between <a href="Interstate%2040%20in%20Tennessee">Interstate 40</a> and <a href="Toone%2C%20Tennessee">Toone</a>, just east of the <a href="Hatchie%20River">Hatchie River</a>. Mercer has a post office; its <a href="zip%20code">zip code</a> is 38392.
History.
Mercer was founded in 1888 by T. B. Mercer, for whom the community is named, at an intersection of a <a href="stagecoach">stagecoach</a> road and the Tennessee Midland Railroad. Mercer erected a <a href="general%20store">general store</a> at the intersection, and it was followed in 1894 by a railroad station officially named Mercer. By the turn of the century, a <a href="lumber%20yard">lumber company</a> and several <a href="church%20%28congregation%29">churches</a> had been established in the area. The community eventually had a bank and an <a href="opera%20house">opera house</a>, but the former <a href="bank%20failure">failed</a> in 1933 and the latter <a href="structure%20fire">burned down</a> in the late 20th century.
